New Records: Dejounte Murray recorded his 20th career triple-double.
Key Match Events: CJ McCollum scored 25 points and Dejounte Murray had a triple-double with 14 points, 12 assists, and 10 rebounds.
Trey Murphy III added 22 points for the Pelicans.
Kyle Kuzma led Washington with 28 points.
Alex Sarr had 18 points and 11 rebounds for the Wizards.
New Orleans scored 17 consecutive points at the end of the first quarter and the start of the second, giving them a 36-22 lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Orleans Pelicans swept a home-and-home set with the Washington Wizards.
The Pelicans moved past the Wizards in the standings in this matchup of the NBA's bottom two teams.
The Pelicans had dropped 11 in a row before winning these two games.
New Orleans has won back-to-back games for the first time since victories in its first two games of the season.
Others: The Wizards were without Jordan Poole (left hip) and Bilal Coulibaly (illness).
Zion Williamson (left hamstring) hasn't played since Nov. 6 for the Pelicans, and Brandon Ingram (left ankle) hasn't played since Dec. 7.
Missi leads all rookies with eight double-doubles, and Sarr is tied for second with four.
Both teams play at home Tuesday night, the Wizards against Houston and the Pelicans against Minnesota.
Game Information: Capital One Arena, 11:00 PM, January 5, 2025, Washington, DC.
Referees: Matt Boland, James Williams, Nate Green.
